conclusion: Determine the work done by the gas from state B to state C.
State A: p_A = p_0, V_A = V_0; State B: p_B = 0.6p_0, V_B = V_0; State C: p_C = 0.6p_0, V_C = 0.5V_0.
Internal energy U is related to temperature T by U = aT.
Internal energy at state A is U_A = aT_0.
Temperature at state C is T_C = U_C/a.
Internal energy for an ideal gas is U = (3/2) nRT.
For a fixed amount of gas, U is proportional to T.
Work done by the gas is W = ∫ p dV from V_B to V_C.
For process B to C, pressure is constant: W_{BC} = 0.6p_0 ∫ dV from V_B to V_C.
The work done by the gas from state B to state C is -0.3p_0 V_0.
